website_summaries.verdict: An innovative alternative to the splatter screen, this silicone cone raises the height of the pan wall to block cooking splatter.
pros: Check pan size before ordering, fits lip-to-lip with same size and slightly smaller pans
Protects and gives complete access to the pan
Blocks fine oil that splatter screens allow through
Great for preventing spillover when sauteing vegetables
Dishwasher safe and easy to clean
When frying, keep edge of frywall above oil line
cons: Not one-size-fits-most option for all your pans

customer_reviews.title: Product started to dissolve after two uses.
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great, and it certainly kept grease from splattering, but after two uses holes started to form and now it seems to be completely breaking down.
customer_reviews.author: John Graziano

customer_reviews.title: Edges melted/disintegrated on first use
customer_reviews.text: First time using it was in a cast iron pan doing some blackened fish. Edges that were in contact with the bottom of the pan melted or disintegrated. Sort of crumbled away. Of course I did not discover this until the pan had cooled. We had already ate the fish and probably some of the frywall. I can say that we had zero splatter when normally the stovetop is covered when cooking this dish. Maybe this cant handle the heat of cast iron and this hot of cooking?
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: Frywall fis perfectly when cool. When the pan gets hot though, the silicone expands, folds appear leaving a gap between the silicone and the wall, and grease escapes, defeating the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: FUG

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Walls of device are too high and make stirring or turning something difficult. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: SaipanRick

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this splatter guard.
customer_reviews.text: I used my Frywall10 for the first time tonight to fry sole filets. Worked like a charm. I was surprised by the amount of oil that accumulated on the Frywall. That's grease that would have ordinarily gone unto the stove, counter and wall. It fit nicely in my 10.5-in All Clad saute pan which means it should also work in the All Clad saucepans since the lids are exactly the same. I washed it by hand and left it on the open dishwasher door to dry.
customer_reviews.author: ezreader

customer_reviews.title: Bought this more out of curiosity, Looks odd, but works fairly well
customer_reviews.text: Its a pricey and odd looking thing,.....and it doesn't catch all the spatter. Thinking an old school screen may catch more, but then, when you lift a screen to check or flip whatever you are cooking,.....you get spatter,....so, its unavoidable,....this does allow you to monitor and easily flip whatever you are cooking and allows moisture to evacuate easily, so two thumbs up on that,....also easily cleaned.....so another thumb up for that,....there you have it,....three thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Collins

customer_reviews.title: FryWall or fallWall.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Frywall, BUT!!!!! Perhaps a flaw in the design. When in use once it heats up becomes flimsy and if accidentally is knocked of pan impossible to reattach while hot. I would give it a 5 star but because of the flaw I will give it 3 star.
customer_reviews.author: Mylene

customer_reviews.title: Too big or too small for every nominal 10 inch pan I own
customer_reviews.text: Reading the enclosed informaiton, I realize this item will never work with the available pans in this house. Directions say to keep the splatter guard from resting on the bottom of the pan, or sitting in the oil/melted fat that's in the bottom. Ridiculous!! Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: hummingbird

customer_reviews.title: Hard to cook with it
customer_reviews.text: It is very hard to cook with this splatter screen and I was really hoping it would be perfect. would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl R.

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS NOW!
customer_reviews.text: I saw this on Shark Tank and I’ve been thinking about buying it since then. I have to admit that the price put me off a bit. But I finally bit the bullet and bought one. I’m getting meal kits from Dinnerly and there is a lots of pan frying. Which means a dirty cooktop. My husband cleans up but I was always having to go behind to make it streak free (I’m a streak free freak!). I LOVE this thing. I used it tonight and it’s made my life better already. I wish it wasn’t sized so I could give these as gifts. I guess I could break in and measure their skillets.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Elkins

customer_reviews.title: Frywall did not prevent grease splatter on my stove top.
customer_reviews.text: We saw this product on Shark Tank and ordered it from Amazon. I hate to fry food because I hate when my stove top is splattered with grease. The Frywall did not prevent the grease from splattered on my stove top. As a matter of fact I used the front burner and grease splattered on the floor and the control panel on the back of the stove. I would not recommend this product. I was very disappointed. Not worth the money. Use a lid on your fry pan.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: W O W !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I made this purchase. It is true that it will fit ANY 10 inch pan. I am loving this Frywall 10 (Medium) - Ultimate Splatter protector. It does protect spills and splatters and most of all it relieves me from having to clean the well of my stove top. I wish it would come in smaller sizes for sauce pans - I would not hesitate to purchase it - it is truly a great invention. I am also glad that storing it does not take up a lot of space - after using it I just put it in the holder it comes in and put it away.
customer_reviews.author: happyday

customer_reviews.title: It works....but the plastic smells
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this...but I noticed that the heat of the pan makes the plastic release a bad smell, and that concerns me.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela De Hasty

customer_reviews.title: Needs a larger pan than the product listing indicates.
customer_reviews.text: The product listing says the pan must be at least 9.5 inches lip-to-lip. I have a pan that is 10 inches lip-to-lip and 9 inches across the bottom. The Frywall is absolutely too big for this pan-- not even close.I have another pan that is 11.5 inches lip-to-lip and 9 inches across the bottoom, and the Frywall fits it snugly. When it fits the pan, it stops most grease spatter and is certainly worth using.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey S. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality & Easy to Clean!
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty well - I like not having to use a screen or cover. When I tried to fry chicken thighs (in just a tablespoon of olive oil) in an iron skillet I still have a good bit of oil on the cooktop - not as much as usual but still have to be cleaned either way! Worked better when I was going some cauliflower rice. It is very heavy weight and I had not trouble at all fitting it into the pans. I also put it in my dishwasher (the kind without heat coils - an Asko) and it came out clean!
customer_reviews.author: Nashville066

customer_reviews.title: My stovetop doesn't resemble a greasy adolescent.
customer_reviews.text: Worked wonderfully! I figured trying up some bacon would be a good test for this product. Definitely made a world of difference. I have a picture of some of the splatter it caught, but it's tough to see. It caught a ton of splatter that would have normally required clean-up. This is much better than a splatter guard because of the continued access to the food you are cooking. Let's face it, when you lift a splatter guard to access your food, oil/grease goes everywhere anyways. Easy to "install" and easy clean-up. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Linc Mobb

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping things clean...
customer_reviews.text: These don't catch every splatter but they do at least as well as the traditional metal screen. And the great thing is you just reach into the pan to stir stuff. No need to juggle the super-hot handle of the screen thing while trying to stir the stuff in the pan. Shown in the picture are the medium (red) and large (green.)
customer_reviews.author: Tristan PDX

customer_reviews.title: Mostly great.
customer_reviews.text: I love that it fits in the frying pan but it does take up some room. It mostly protects my stove from spit back when I'm frying but not completely. The clean up of the product itself is great, just rinse with some dish soap and water. I can't testify to durability...yet. It does seem sturdy and that it will last, it's made of silicone but not too thin that I will be afraid it will rip. It's much better then the splatter screens sold in that you can still easily cook your food without removing the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Awesome new invention for the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: So you think all the amazing inventions had already been invented? Wrong. They keep on coming. This one is right straight out of the box. Everyone who fries knows what a mess it can leave on the stove even when you use one of those flat, screen spatter guard. This silicone cone seems to catch 99.9% of the fat particles. And that's just the beginning. For cooking kale, it is great.. I could go on and on but I think you get the idea. This is a simple invention that solves a big problem.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: I used my 10-inch fry wall for the first time last night. I really liked it a lot and it's much better than the screens that you lay over the pan that do nothing because the grease pops right through those. My only problem was that it was so flexible especially after heated up if you accidentally touch it on the sides. Also because it comes folded it had a crease in it which left a gap that was hard to close so I have to find a place to store it where it can stay and it's natural round shape so that it won't crease.
customer_reviews.author: Karen W.

customer_reviews.title: No More Splatters
customer_reviews.text: This Frywall is great! I have used multiple different splatter guards in the past, but the one problem with them all was that you had to remove them to check on whatever you were frying or to turn over food in the frypan. You get constant line of sight of the food you are frying, such as bacon, with this Frywall and no splatter anywhere on the stove top. Super easy to use, clean and store. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Don't Believe the Hype!!
customer_reviews.text: I saw this on Shark Tank and had to order them! Once I received them and tested them out in a pan.... disappointed!! They are too high, it is awkward to cook with.... I returned these ASAP!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hate turned to love!
customer_reviews.text: At first, I hated this thing... then I figured out how to place it correctly. Read the instructions! It definitely takes a bit of finesse to get it into the pan properly. But, once you do... it works really well! I use it all the time now and my stove top stays much cleaner than with the old school screen mesh splatter guard. Kind of pricey for what it is, but if it lasts (and I can't see how it wouldn't), worth it!
customer_reviews.author: G. Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean-up!
customer_reviews.text: The Frywall was 90% effective in keeping the grease inside the pan. I think if it was just a little higher, it would be more effective. Nevertheless, it made cleaning up much easier and I'll use it all the time. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: bill8931

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims! You need this product!
customer_reviews.text: Works as it said it would! Quick fried podrano peppers for tapas - first time without this product grease was everywhere! Conventional spatter guard not useful because you have to be stirring all the time. Saw this and decided to try it. Peppers perfect and clean up as if I hadn't used the stove!
customer_reviews.author: krystalspin

customer_reviews.title: Useful but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: While the concept is great it is very difficult to use. The silicon cone keeps flopping into the pan if it is even slightly disturbed. This design makes it almost impossible to reach in and stir or turn the food being fried.
customer_reviews.author: Sometimes unhappy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea. Saw on Shark Tank. Didn’t like at all. Bought 2 sizes. Neither fit the circumference of my Farbeware pots n pans correctly! They rise too high to be able to stir the food in the pan. Don’t waste your money like I did!!! @ $50 down the drain!!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry A. Krafczek

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly useful
customer_reviews.text: fits well in all my 10-in pans, prevent the oil splatter and food spill, also helps to fit pan cover of slightly different size to the pan. It's easy to clean, can flip inside-out then wipe with hot water or soapy water. After dishwasher, I can see some white trace, need to wash it off by hand. Need to watch the temperature when use it with stainless steel pan as the pan bottom can get really hot >450F, the wall of pan is ~70F lower than bottom, make sure the plastic does not touch bottom. It's not a big concern when use with non-stick pan, usually lower than 450F.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: I have all 3 sizes of the Frywall and they work great. I browned 3 pounds of meatballs without any splatters on my cooktop. I do think they work best with pans that have straight, rather than sloped sides, such as cast iron skillets and the All Clad brand. That being said, the 10” Frywall doesn’t fit as well as the other sizes. I’ve found that most pans are 10.5-11” so I think that’s part of the problem. But even with the looser fit, it still works better than a splatter screen.
customer_reviews.author: jillybean

customer_reviews.title: This is a game changer
customer_reviews.text: I've started pan frying and deep frying more since quarantine began, but I was tired of cleaning up oil so often on my stove. I've had this on my wishlist for a while now and remembered that it was there, so I decided to take a chance on this product. No regrets. Fits my 10 inch pan and my boyfriend's cast iron skillet perfectly. Makes clean up a breeze. Cleaning it is pretty easy, though it seems like no matter how hard or how long I scrub it, it seems to leave behind a bit of a residue, like random spots. But it's a minor concern honestly, still would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Scherer

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL SATISFACTION!
customer_reviews.text: This product is superb!! I have now cooked using the Frywall 10 splatter guard for about one month, this is a follow up review after my initial thoughts. I COULD NOT BE BE MORE PLEASED!!! Easy to fit to the pan, easy to remove and clean, easy and compact to store, what more is required?? NOTHING!! The cooker top is completely devoid of any splatter after using Frywall and I have cooked bacon, sausage, fish, stir fry, steak, pork, etc. The product is simple, superb and does the the job exactly as it claimed it would. I couldn't be a happier customer!! BUY ONE NOW if you want to stop cleaning a messy cooker top!!
customer_reviews.author: citizenyorky

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE SPLATTER TO CLEAN UP!  Love this gadget....
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific kitchen gadget and eliminates greasy splatter onto your stove area that is such a pain to clean up. We have a black smooth surface cook top, so this is particularly true of that type of cook top - such a pain!. But no more with this Frywall. Admittedly, it took some getting used to given you are adding, stirring, etc., ingredients over the top of the guard so-to-speak, but so worth it. Also, it cleans up quickly and folds up for easy storage. I have ordered both a medium and a large. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kitke

customer_reviews.title: Works in 10" frying pan, 10" Wok and 12" Wok
customer_reviews.text: I have now used the 10" Frywall I bought after using the 8" version, it was equally useful. I use the 8" version whenever I am frying eggs, it keeps the stove-top clean. When the eggs are cooked I move the whole pan to the counter over the dishwasher, open the dishwasher, put in the Frywall, close the dishwasher. No drips, no fuss, no mess. An excellent product. I have now used the 10" in a 10" pan, and as expected, no problems. It also works well in 10" and 12" Woks, but it is a bit too small to use in a 10" square frying pan.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This works like a charm! It’s not 100% effective more like 85% and that makes it more then worth it! I used to have to deep clean the stove after making burgers now it’s a simple wipe with bounty and we are good. I’ve washed it twice in the dishwasher and it comes out clean. It’s not everyday you get something that works as advertised and this does!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Draven

customer_reviews.title: IT REALLY WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Saw all the positive review, and so I bought it. It really works! I am cooking with cast iron pan the oil splashing was well controlled. The heat can not get high enough to damage the Frywall. No discoloration. I do not wash it on every use & the oil did not stick. Very easy to wash. Easy to use. Good quality. 5 stars, good buy :)
customer_reviews.author: Hernan R

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I was initially looking for the typical food splatter we all know about where you put it on top and you have to lift it up to turn your food etc thus still getting some splatter on your stove top. When I spotted this product...I recalled watching the episode of Shark Tank when they pitched the idea...I loved it and I am so happy it's available. I have one in each size and they are very easy to use, clean and more importantly, you can flip your food over with having to lift or move anything!!!
customer_reviews.author: SimpleChic

customer_reviews.title: Dishwasher safe in top rack. Does not melt when used in hot pan.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two - in the 8" for individual serving, and the larger 10" for bigger frying pans and for cooking down large quanties of greens such as spinach. The Frywall catches most of the mess associated with stove-top cooking. If you have something that really splatters, perch a spatter screen on top of the Frywall. I have only a moderately effective range hood - goes through a filter, not external exhaust- and the Frywall really helps prevent ugly clean-up chores. I keep them rolled up in coffee mugs on my counter top - I use them THAT OFTEN.
customer_reviews.author: MLS

customer_reviews.title: Ok but...
customer_reviews.text: Although this splatter guard is handy, it doesn’t quite fit a larger frying pan. I’ve noticed that when it touches the bottom of the frying pan, some food gets stuck between the shield and pan and then you have to adjust it. It also folds over if you touch it while leaning your hand into the pan. It did keep my stove clean. I think I’ll stick to good old fashioned round flat splatter shields
customer_reviews.author: Vpk873

customer_reviews.title: Almost a very good solution
customer_reviews.text: It's okay but not great. In some ways better than the traditional metal screen placed on pans to keep the splatter down but the device doesn't like to stay in place well. Have to make sure not to accidentally touch the edge of the device else it will shift or worse, fall off. A bit more sturdy and it would work very well and get a better rating. Will look for a better solution than the metal screen or this product.
customer_reviews.author: Running Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Reduces cleanup of stainless cooktop
customer_reviews.text: We get Plated meals twice and week and most of their recipes require use of a frying pan on the cooktop/stovetop. We have both the medium and large Frywalls and they definitely make cleanup of our cooktop much easier. My husband is the chef, and he has gotten used to using them, although there are a few times he has said it is hard to manipulate the food in the pan with the Frywall on it. These are things that you have to flip with a spatula. I like that you can put them in the dishwasher, because they do retain cooking smells. All in all a useful product
customer_reviews.author: RFG

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product and have been looking for something like this for a while. I saw this on Shark Tank and knew I needed this in my kitchen. It works wonderfully and does exactly what it says it does. I used to have to wipe down my stovetop after frying but not anymore! It's also easy to clean, which is a big plus. Buy this! You will not regret it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Candy B.

customer_reviews.title: very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: very happy with this. Also Yair was very responsive answering questions via email before i purchased. As others have said, it is a huge improvement over a splatter guard - i have had it for about a month and i definitely pan-fry more than i used to, just because i used to hate the cleanup so much. I wish it came in an 8" size as well. i am a single person, and i usually use a smaller pan when cooking for one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfection, savior
customer_reviews.text: This is the answer to my prayers. I avoided using the stove because I HATE splatter and grease on the surface and cleaning it. This device is absolutely perfect. I ised it frying chicken ( what can be messier?). Because chicken is so full of moisture, it’s splatter reached almost the top of the “wall”, but not the stove itself. There is nothing I did not like. Will buy any other size that comes on the market. Thank you, my family thanks you because I have deprived them from anything that requires a lot of stove cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Alma

customer_reviews.title: Your chef, stove and countertops will be very happy!
customer_reviews.text: nothing bad to say here. do lots of bacon and other splattering meals. Frywall makes cleanup a breeze. Splatters, TAKE A HIKE, theres a new Sheriff in town and likes bacon. Looking forward to different sizes and colors. Save yourself or someone you care about time and money cleaning up get a FRYWALL. price point spot. If I haven't been clear, I endorse.
customer_reviews.author: Doogerexpress

customer_reviews.title: Going to Order Another in the Larger Size!
customer_reviews.text: From the above tag, I guess you can tell that I am very satisfied with this product. I decided to use it for a couple of weeks before doing the review so that I could speak from experience. I had no problem figuring out how to use it - the instructions were very clear. I cooked salmon, which was quite oily, fried cutlets, a vegetable medley, and bacon and eggs. I used two different pans to see if it worked well in both. It did a terrific job. There were no greasy spots on my gas stove/parts or the adjoining counter. It's easy to clean, and stores well in the provided sleeve. I intend to buy the larger size too.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Bernadette Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great in theory
customer_reviews.text: I bought the product to limit spatter when cooking, and it is good in theory, but not so good in functionality. There is reduced large splatter, but everything near my cooktop is still covered in a fine mist of oil. Very disappointing for the $
customer_reviews.author: L.Z.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ITEM
customer_reviews.text: I saw this item when it was on Shark Tank and thought what a brilliant idea and it truly is. I HATE splatter when I am cooking something on my stove and this truly resolves that issue. I use a lot of fresh spinach when I make things and you can wilt down a huge amount in a fry pan, just works great.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Carter

customer_reviews.title: Good Concept...not practical for our family
customer_reviews.text: Not super pleased with this item. Ultimately returned it. It does not fit our pans right and we tried them all. Eggs were a disaster in it. Yes it kept splatter down but the cleaning and work around as you are trying to flip eggs or bacon etc is kinda a pain.
customer_reviews.author: hart3856

customer_reviews.title: Not a cure all
customer_reviews.text: Used it last night for hamburgers in a cast iron pan. It did a great job of keeping the splatter away from the hot burner, but everything else on the stove was splattered with grease. I don’t use my dishwasher, so hand washing this is a real chore. Even Dawn doesn’t cut through the greasy silicone. Overall it helps with splatter, but does not eliminate it.
customer_reviews.author: DJH cat

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Why wasn't this invented a long time ago?
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Splatter screens never worked very well for me & it always felt like such a laboriously huge job to need clean up the ENTIRE oven surface after frying something simple for dinner, but this little tool eliminates almost 90% of the splatter.
customer_reviews.author: MSmith

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertized
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim and had a chance to use it last weekend to cook a steak. It does a great job of keeping the oil and fat from spraying out the pan and didn't hamper spatula access to the meat.
customer_reviews.author: Kokodude

customer_reviews.title: Love to Cook; Hate to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for nearly all my stovetop cooking for a few months now but waited to see how it would hold up before writing a review. The medium size is perfect for our small family. I avoided a lot of stovetop cooking because it was a pain to remove splatter on my black gas stove. Standard splatter guards didn't do the trick. With Frywall? Not an issue. Just loop it across a few spindles in the top rack of the dishwasher, and it comes out clean. Every. Time.
customer_reviews.author: SJ Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly. No hassle with set-up. It fits my 10" Lodge Cast Iron Skillet perfectly. It rests on the sides (about a 1/2 inch up from the bottom) of the pan and keeps the spatter off everything. It also fits all my other 10" skillets-even those with straight sides. I orignally saw this on Shark Tank -otherwise I never would have known about it - and bought from Amazon. A+++
customer_reviews.author: Blue Desert

customer_reviews.title: Keeps stove and granite counters free of most splatters
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying using my new Splatter Guard. I first used it with a 9 1/2 inch pan and it worked well, but with the 10 inch it is a perfect fit. As I fry bacon I can see the splatters hit the side of the guard instead of on my granite. The guard goes into the dishwasher and comes out clean and ready for the next use. This is a product I will recommend to friends and family. I am planning on buying the large size for larger pots.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Steinke

customer_reviews.title: it cleans up and stores nicely.
customer_reviews.text: I have a black top gas stove so whenever I fried something the grease was everywhere! Saw this product on Shark Tank and thought I would give it a try. Fried pork chops and no grease on the stove. Then cooked some bacon and again no grease. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because I am on 5ft tall and it was a little difficult to reach over the fry wall to turn the food. BTW, it cleans up and stores nicely.
customer_reviews.author: janice l

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty cool and does what it’s supposed to do. It’s a littl awkward to cook with but when faced with the alternative, grease splatter all over the stove, it’s worth the effort. It goes in the dishwasher but takes up a lot of space. Overall I like it and will continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Rockmother

customer_reviews.title: Handy and helpful
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd Frywall purchase, since we already had the 12" version, and we're just as happy with it as our 1st. It works simply and exactly as advertised to slip into the pan and keep spatters at bay. Then, cleanup and storage is easy. For folks that do a lot of saute' work or frying, we highly recommend this, it's really been great for us to keep the range top clean.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Kass

customer_reviews.title: very large
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product after seeing it on shark tank and I thought that I needed it as a new addition to my kitchen gadget collection. Once i received the product, it was a it was a lot larger than i expected! It only fits very large wok type pans. I would love if they had a smaller size to fit more everyday pots/pans.
customer_reviews.author: Niles Getz

customer_reviews.title: I returned mine
customer_reviews.text: I returned mine. I couldn't get a good fit in my sauté pans and found this product to be pretty worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Bocaboy

customer_reviews.title: Best splatter guard out there
customer_reviews.text: Just bought a new range and am obsessed with keeping it clean and not having anything splatter on it. The frywall works as advertised and not one drop of splatter got anywhere but on the frywall itself. The only splatter guard that I’m aware of that doesn’t cover the food so you can still mix and cook as you. Now time to order the other sizes!
customer_reviews.author: Marc P

customer_reviews.title: It really works!!!
customer_reviews.text: So glad that I purchased. Had really cut down on splatter. I have glass shelves over my sink, near my stove and I had to CLEAN every week. Now I can just dust them and clean ~ every three weeks! I actually a splatter guard with the frywall. So easy to use. No splatter. Clean stove and shelves. A true time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective, be careful of your temps.
customer_reviews.text: Product works as described. I cook in cast iron and probably got it a little too hot. Product didnt melt but the edge touching the pan got a little lighter in color and might have deformed slightly. I still use it but make sure to keep dials below 8 on my gas range. Easy to clean, kind of odd to store.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy H- Truthful reviews

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Gave the Frywall the ultimate first use test: pan fried chicken. Splatter contained! Ran it through the dishwasher, and folded it for storage. Due to it's flared shape it does take up quite a bit of stovetop space while in use. I wish it was slightly smaller so it would also fit my Circulon 3.5 qt. saute pan that I use for short ribs. Pricey, but worth it given the results.
customer_reviews.author: Mla

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: This is such an easy to use, easy to clean, ingenious invention. I find it endlessly frustrating when I cook bacon of lamb chops that the spatter covers not only the stop top and grates, but also anything else I have on the stove (like my kettle). While the Frywall doesn't completely stop this it reduces the amount of spatter dramatically. It also folds/rolls for easy storage (I keep mine in a saucepan).
customer_reviews.author: Lucette

customer_reviews.title: splatter guard / silicone
customer_reviews.text: I found this a very awkward design. Can't reach in to turn pieces of food. Awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Brilliantly sensible product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product; does exactly what manufacturer says it does. Frying & sauteing simply don't make the mess of the stove top that we had before we bought this. Cleaning is easy: just fill your skillet with hot, soapy water, throw the spatter guard in folded and flat-ish and turn it a couple of times. An hour later it's clean. We love the way it stores; takes up very little space.
customer_reviews.author: EerieCats

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical when my friend recommended this, but the day i got it
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when my friend recommended this, but the day i got it, i needed to saute onions, and mushrooms, Thanks, now I;m not sure i can cook without it.
customer_reviews.author: JGok

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I've thought about this item for awhile and finally purchased it. I'm so glad I did! I don't fry alot, but I do brown meat before putting it in the crock pot. I was very pleased at how well it worked. I've only used it a couple of times, so I can;t speak to durability. I put it in the dishwasher to clean. Can't get easier than that! And there was no cleaning my cook top!
customer_reviews.author: N. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Not splatter free
customer_reviews.text: This does not prevent all oil splatter. If you’re using at medium heat cooking vegetables for example, I got very little oil splatter. However when I cooked a burger pattie at high heat, I still got considerable oil splatter that leaked out of the pan and onto the stove top. It did limit the splatter but you’ll still need to clean off the residual oil that will splatter out of the product. I think for what you get, the cost should be half of what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a new home a year ago in a retirement community and we just replaced the cooktop with a Bosh gas stovetop with 5 burners. It is absolutely beautiful and is a dream to use, I wanted to care for it and keep it as clean as possible and after one meal where there was a good deal of splatter I decided to purchase the Frywall, actually I had seen it on a deals and steals opportunity and didn't purchase it. Somehow I missed it on Shark Tank or I probably would have ordered it that night. I'm not big on gadgets but this is a terrific addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine C Bryda

customer_reviews.title: Too cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: While this keeps splatters to a minimum, it is too cumbersome to use and very awkward to clean. Yes, it is dishwasher safe but too floppy for dishwasher. Good idea but needs more tweaking.
customer_reviews.author: Mooselady

customer_reviews.title: Contains the mess when frying
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised for keeping the splatter contained when frying. Great for electric stovetops in particular. Fully cleaning the frywall is tricky at best. My best luck was with filling the sink with water and leaving the frywall standing open and upright to soak. Then working around the inside surface with a sponge. There’s a bit of white residue sometimes after it dries, but it’s at least 95% clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mine

customer_reviews.title: Solves the problem, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Oh my I love this product! It fit perfectly in my 10 inch skillet, I did not even read the directions. I cooked pork chops and a side dish no mess all over the stove. I tried three different screens trying to avoid the stove mess, none of them worked. (Even my favorite brand Oxo was barely any improvement). This is the way to go. Thanks for all the reviews that helped me find this.
customer_reviews.author: Valuegal

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life
customer_reviews.text: This simple solution to grease spatter is amazing. I put it in the pan and then cook as usual but the spatter is contained saving lots of clean up. It goes in the dishwasher and comes out great.
customer_reviews.author: Manhattantraveller

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my stovetop clean when I saute! Cleans easily in the dishwasher. Folds up quite small for storage. *Much* better than a screen spatter lid, which lets most spatters escape to the top of the stove. I've had to relearn a little bit of my spatula/tongs technique because of the high rim, but I worked it all out on the first use.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bates

customer_reviews.title: Top notch!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love it! Not one drop of oil on my stove while I fried breakfast sausage. Normally I have to take the grates off to totally wash down the stove top. I am calling my sister to tell her if this fabulous product. Thank you for the inventor.
customer_reviews.author: Quin Walwark

customer_reviews.title: You don't know you need it until you own one.
customer_reviews.text: This has basically changed my cooking life (yes, I am a bit dramatic). But really, this has changed my life. I used to be afraid when frying. always approaching the pan from the side or even doing the dip and run LOL!, but now I can cook and not worry about the excess splatter hitting me on my arms, chest or stomach. I did not realize how badly I needed this until I actually used it. I am going to buy these as stocking stuffers for some of my family this Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are not overselling the capabilities of this product - it works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with some trepidation, as things like this are long on promises and short on delivery, but my wife hates cleaning our stove of splatter, so.......... After one use, it delivered big time. No splatter, it fits perfectly, and it was easy to clean. I can't ask for anything more.
customer_reviews.author: Russell L. Henkel

customer_reviews.title: Not effective on my gas stove
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this out but there was still significant splatter when frying, I think because I'm using a gas stove and the oil reaches high temperatures causing it to jump pretty high. It did catch quite a bit of the splatter but if I still have to clean up afterwards it defeats the purpose of using it. Ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Aisha F

customer_reviews.title: Spatter care
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product!!! I reduces the spatter of grease immensely. I would suggest that it seems to be good to use a spatter lid also. This will reduce even more spatter. I just set the spatter lid down in the frywall. Very Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: larilynn

customer_reviews.title: Nice to not have to clean all the grease splatter.
customer_reviews.text: Once you figure how this item fits with the pan, it is great! It doesn't contain all the splatters, but definitely a significant reduction in splatter cleanup. The big shape makes washing a challenge, but just put in the soapy water wash outside then flip inside out and wash the "outside" (really the inside) again. Dry with towel and set-up in pan if you want to air dry it.
customer_reviews.author: mp

customer_reviews.title: Makes clean-up a breeze!
customer_reviews.text: Great at reducing mess from frying or simmering sauces! Worth it if only to prevent spaghetti sauce splatters all over my stove. I hate having to hunt for errant splatters where ever you didn't expect them, and this prevents the splatters in the first place. Since it's silicone, nothing much sticks to it. All it takes is a soapy sponge to clean it. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this twice, but found that it worked as advertised. My stove top was protected from splatters, it cleans up nicely, is very easy to store in it's plastic container, and takes up very little space.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieMoo

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised - and color is pretty. Comes with a clear sleeve for storage but ...
customer_reviews.text: Has not had sufficient use for me to 5 star it. Definitely improves clean up aspect of fry/saute spattering area on my glass top stove - and granite counter surround. Have washed it dishwasher and in sink. Need a month of use to properly comment. Works as advertised - and color is pretty. Comes with a clear sleeve for storage but far more practical to leave out. Fits 10 pan well and I may buy another in 12 size.
customer_reviews.author: Shoukre

customer_reviews.title: thought it was the best idea ever
customer_reviews.text: I saw it on the Today show, thought it was the best idea ever, I bought it, used it and love it. I sauté often but hate cleaning my stove top, this item solves the problem 100%. The storage sleeve is also brilliant, if you hate cleaning your stove top or just hate grease going everywhere, this is for you. Will pay for itself in labor charges and cleaning product. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jill R Dector

customer_reviews.title: WORKS AS ADVERTISED !!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Kept cooktop clean, no splatter at all. Not all the muss and fuss as with the splatter screens and it went thru dishwasher in a snap. Just be sure you put it in the pan BEFORE heating pan. I'm going to order another size is a different color. Great idea and priced well.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Coast

customer_reviews.title: So amazing
customer_reviews.text: Bought the larger one last year and finally bought the 10” one this year. Don’t know why I waited. These are so great! Keeps my stove clean and makes cleanup easy. Bring them camping and love having less of a mess to clean-up.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Frywall works
customer_reviews.text: I saw the Frywall on a cooking show and decided to try one. It came quickly and was awesome. Nearly all grease spatters were gone. Cleaning our new stovetop was so much easier. The next day I ordered 3 more for my kids. They love it as well. I thought cleaning it would be difficult but it is quite easy. Just wipe the outside with a soapy sponge then flip it inside out and wipe again. Just watch out when you open the package. It comes folded in a clear plastic cone thing. I ended up cutting 2/3s through the thing before I realized that it was also used to store the Frywall. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ac

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I do like that it actually works in keeping the grease from flying all over the stove area. Just make sure it fits the fry pan that you will use. It doesn't stretch it's ONE SIZE only. Expensive but, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M.

customer_reviews.title: It works! Easy to use and store
customer_reviews.text: Love at first use. Used it last night in a pan that sat it on the frying surface. No problems! Had just bought my first glass top stove, and was freaking about grease. No problems! Easy to use. Put in dishwasher for cleanup. Easy to store because it comes with a sleeve that keeps it compact for drawer or shelf storage. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Keeps 95-98% of splatters off the stove while frying with the top being open so there is no steam buildup.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Best way ever to keep stovetop free of splatters
customer_reviews.text: I will never sautee/fry anything again without using this splashguard! It absolutely works as described. I owned this for a month and had to buy the one for 12" skillets as well. Yep, looks a little strange, but works wonders. Just place in the dishwasher after using and it cleans up perfectly. Wonderful discovery for my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Linda K Self

customer_reviews.title: Saves Messy Cleanups
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. At first I hesitated to buy. Took a chance and it is fabulous. I have it now for 10 inch pan and 12 inch pan. Washes up beautifully in the dishwasher. It is everything the product claims to be. Will purchase for Christmas presents.
customer_reviews.author: Francie

customer_reviews.title: really works
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. Before when cooking bacon, my stove was a greasy mess. Now with the frywall cleanup is easy. Just remove from the pan and wash with soap and water. It comes with storage sleeve which makes it handy to store
customer_reviews.author: noodleman

customer_reviews.title: You’ve gotta have this!!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life? No more cleaning up splatters!! Super easy to use. Before if I didn’t want splatters I had to use a screen which was a pain because you always have to lift it to turn food. Then when you would lift the screen to turn the food you would get tons of splatters. Not with this!! I love it so much I bought one for my daughter. Now I’m going to order all the sizes!! If I were Oprah this would be on my favorite things list!! Best kitchen invention in years!!
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This could be the best thing in my kitchen. Why you ask? Because I didn't have to spend a half hour cleaning spatters from wall and stove top after cooking bacon this a.m. Other spatter guards just don't do it like this one. Thanks for a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A great idea that works!
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful product! I’ve ordered two more because I haven’t had to clean the stove top and the back plate since using the Splatter Guard. This product is easy to use, easy to clean and easy to store! I am so impressed that I have ordered another one.
customer_reviews.author: Williethel Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Great device, it actually works.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works! I cook steaks/chops in my cast iron at high temp which can create wide splatter. I have an older 3-sided aluminum splatter screen that’s worthless, but this catches most of the splatter. Stick in the dishwasher for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Atlantic Aviator

customer_reviews.title: These things are fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: These things are fantastic! I don’t know why there are so many negative reviews. Maybe the company improved the product? It fits the pans easily and perfectly. It is easy to store by just folding it up and slipping it into the provided sleeve. I just slip it into a dish slot in my dishwasher to clean. And it keeps all the splatter off the stove! The only downside is that it is a bit pricey. But hey...it works! I bought both sizes. The large does take a lot of room. But I can use both sizes at the same time on a 4 burner stove.
customer_reviews.author: W. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: It is quite large. I purchased the 12" also ...
customer_reviews.text: It is quite large. I purchased the 12" also and returned that one. This one is still quite large and hard to stir things because it is high up over the skillet.
customer_reviews.author: Inky

product_meta.title: Frywall 10 (Medium) - Red - Splatter Guard, as Seen on Shark Tank
product_meta.description: Color:RedFrywall splatter guard keeps your stovetop spotless no matter the meal, providing better protection than splatter screens while keeping your pan completely accessible throughout the cooking process. You can fry, simmer, or sauté as you would with an uncovered pan, and still keep your stovetop spotless. It’s perfect for deep fried delicacies like fried chicken and latkes, as well as for pan-fried burgers and steaks, bacon, bubbling tomato sauce, or that huge pile of greens that always tumbles onto the stovetop. Frywall is dishwasher safe and rolls up into a compact sleeve for storage. Made of BPA-free, FDA-compliant high temperature silicone rated to 450°F. Pan not included. U.S. Patent Nos. 9,784,302 and 10,130,213. Other patent applications are pending.
feature_bullets: FITS 10” PANS – Verify your pan size before ordering. Will not fit pans with lip-to-lip diameters smaller than 9.5". Not suitable for downdraft stoves.

NO COMPROMISE PROTECTION: The first-ever splatter guard that combines uninterrupted protection with complete access to cooking surface, providing all the benefits of an uncovered pan without the mess.

STOPS OIL MIST AND CONDENSATION: Completely blocks fine oil that splatter screens let through, but lets steam escape freely. So burgers sear perfectly, sauces reduce quickly, and condensation splatter is eliminated.
SPILLOVER STOPPER: Perfect for preventing spillovers when sautéing lots of veggies and greens in overfull pan.

SAFE, CLEAN AND COMPACT: Made of BPA-free, FDA-compliant silicone that can withstand sustained temperatures of up to 450°F. Dishwasher safe and easy to clean. After use rolls into cup-sized sleeve for compact storage.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,682 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
